definitions.definition: The planned movement of troops , vehicles etc.; a strategic repositioning ; ( later also ) a large training field- exercise of fighting units.
examples: Joint NATO maneuvers are as much an exercise in diplomacy as in tactics and logistics.

definitions.definition: Any strategic or cunning action; a stratagem .
A movement of the body , or with an implement, instrument etc., especially one performed with skill or dexterity.
A specific medical or surgical movement, often eponymous, done with the doctor's hands or surgical instruments.
examples: The otorhinolaryngologist performed an Epley maneuver and the patient was relieved of his vertigo.

definitions.definition: A controlled (especially skillful) movement taken while steering a vehicle .
examples: Parallel parking can be a difficult maneuver .

main_definition: ( military ) The planned movement of troops , vehicles etc.; a strategic repositioning ; ( later also ) a large training field- exercise of fighting units. [from 18th c.]
secondary_definitions: Any strategic or cunning action; a stratagem . [from 18th c.]
A movement of the body , or with an implement, instrument etc., especially one performed with skill or dexterity. [from 18th c.]
( medicine ) A specific medical or surgical movement, often eponymous, done with the doctor's hands or surgical instruments. [from 18th c.]
A controlled (especially skillful) movement taken while steering a vehicle . [from 18th c.]
